[HEADING] Full-time MBA Events
The Georgia Tech Full-time MBA program is our traditional two-year offering, with a focus on immersive and experiential learning at the intersection of business and technology. The program brings together skilled students from around the world and connects them to top-ranked career services, STEM-designated concentrations, and a close-knit community to drive their career transformations.
Learn why our Full-time MBA program is ranked one of the best in the nation.
Top-Ranked Career Services
Find your career path within an ever-evolving landscape with help from the Jones MBA Career Center. With a small student to advisor ratio, you'll get personalized services tailored to your needs.
Hands-On Experience
Gain real-world experience with corporate innovators and start-ups in the Tech Square ecosystem through practicums, projects, internships, and more.
Dynamic & Diverse Community
We're focused on collaboration and camaraderie over cutthroat competition in a program that emphasizes community and inclusion.

Meet the Georgia Tech Scheller MBA
The Georgia Tech Full-time MBA program is our traditional two-year offering, with a focus on immersive and experiential learning at the intersection of business and technology. The program brings together skilled students from around the world and connects them to top-ranked career services, STEM-designated concentrations, and a close-knit community to drive their career transformations.  








Get to Know Us

Find your career path within an ever-evolving landscape with help from the Jones MBA Career Center. With a small student to advisor ratio, you'll get personalized services tailored to your needs.

Gain real-world experience with corporate innovators and start-ups in the Tech Square ecosystem through practicums, projects, internships, and more.

We're focused on collaboration and camaraderie over cutthroat competition in a program that emphasizes community and inclusion.

Meet the Georgia Tech Scheller MBA
The Georgia Tech Full-time MBA program is our traditional two-year offering, with a focus on immersive and experiential learning at the intersection of business and technology. The program brings together skilled students from around the world and connects them to top-ranked career services, STEM-designated concentrations, and a close-knit community to drive their career transformations.
Get to Know Us

Meet the Georgia Tech Scheller MBA
The Georgia Tech Full-time MBA program is our traditional two-year offering, with a focus on immersive and experiential learning at the intersection of business and technology. The program brings together skilled students from around the world and connects them to top-ranked career services, STEM-designated concentrations, and a close-knit community to drive their career transformations.
Get to Know Us
Program Highlights
Learn why our Full-time MBA program is ranked one of the best in the nation.

Top-Ranked Career Services
Find your career path within an ever-evolving landscape with help from the Jones MBA Career Center. With a small student to advisor ratio, you'll get personalized services tailored to your needs.

Hands-On Experience
Gain real-world experience with corporate innovators and start-ups in the Tech Square ecosystem through practicums, projects, internships, and more.

Make your mark on the business world. Georgia Tech Scheller prepares students to successfully navigate business challenges in any industry. Our graduates become innovative leaders who thrive in a tech-driven society.
Whether you’re beginning your business education as an undergrad, ready to advance in your career with an MBA, or start your journey as an academic with a Ph.D., we have a program to help you excel at the intersection of business and technology.
This website uses cookies. For more information review our Cookie Policy

Make Your Mark





Make your mark on the business world. Georgia Tech Scheller prepares students to successfully navigate business challenges in any industry. Our graduates become innovative leaders who thrive in a tech-driven society.
Whether you’re beginning your business education as an undergrad, ready to advance in your career with an MBA, or start your journey as an academic with a Ph.D., we have a program to help you excel at the intersection of business and technology.











 
Undergraduate
Begin your business education with the Bachelor of Science in Business Administration (BSBA) program. The program is your path to gaining a strong foundation in business and in-demand skills that will get you hired.

Learn More



 

 
M.S. Major in Management: On-Campus or Online
Add to your business acumen and career readiness with a M.S. Major in Management degree, now offered in either a full-time on-campus format or fully online, flexible format.

Learn More



 

 
 MBA
Gain critical business acumen, career services, and a global network to advance or pivot in your career. Scheller offers three Master of Business Administration (MBA) program formats: Full-time, Evening, and Executive MBA. 

Learn More



 

 
Ph.D.
Become an innovative scholar in your chosen business field with our Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) program.

Learn More



 

 
Graduate Certificates
Expand your knowledge and understanding of data analytics in business with a 100% online Graduate Certificate in Business Analytics.

Learn More



 

 
Executive Education
Learn how to drive growth and lead innovation through open enrollment courses and certificates for individuals and custom programs for organizations.

Learn More



 

 
Interdisciplinary M.S.
Learn more about interdisciplinary master’s programs in Quantitative and Computational Finance (QCF) and Analytics.

Learn More



 

 
Student Certificates
Augment your undergraduate or graduate studies at a Georgia Tech student and gain more depth in specific areas of business. 

Learn More

Make Your Mark
Make your mark on the business world. Georgia Tech Scheller prepares students to successfully navigate business challenges in any industry. Our graduates become innovative leaders who thrive in a tech-driven society.
Whether you’re beginning your business education as an undergrad, ready to advance in your career with an MBA, or start your journey as an academic with a Ph.D., we have a program to help you excel at the intersection of business and technology.
Undergraduate
Begin your business education with the Bachelor of Science in Business Administration (BSBA) program. The program is your path to gaining a strong foundation in business and in-demand skills that will get you hired.

Learn More



 

 
M.S. Major in Management: On-Campus or Online

Learn More



 

 
 MBA

pages.title: Explore Programs

pages.content:
[HEADING] MBA Early Admission for Undergrads
[HEADING] Get Accepted Now, Start Your MBA Later
[HEADING] Learn More About MBA Early Admission for Undergrads
[HEADING] Why Pursue MBA Early Action?
[HEADING] MBA Early Action Benefits
[HEADING] Early Admission Eligibility
[HEADING] Application and Admissions
[HEADING] Application Deadlines
[HEADING] How to Apply
[HEADING] Submit Your Application
[HEADING] Admitted Student Requirements
[HEADING] Financing Your MBA
MBA Early Admission for Undergrads allows undergraduates from institutions nationwide to secure deferred, early decision to the Georgia Tech Scheller Full-time or Evening MBA programs.
MBA Early Admission for Undergrads allows you to plan ahead and secure admission during the final year of your undergraduate studies. Once you are admitted, you will work full-time after graduation, then enroll in our Full-time MBA program or continue working as you enter our Evening MBA program.
Undergraduate students of all disciplines can get a jump start on career plans by gaining early action to Georgia Tech Scheller’s Full-time and Evening MBA programs. Any U.S. citizen attending an accredited U.S. college or university is eligible to apply.
The MBA Early Admission for Undergrads program allows students from colleges and universities worldwide to secure deferred or early decision to the Georgia Tech Scheller Full-time or Evening MBA programs.
Your undergraduate degree prepares you for the working world, and an MBA will leverage your work experience to broaden your knowledge, give you a competitive advantage in the job market, and help grow your career more quickly.
MBA Early Admission for Undergrads applicants receive:
An application fee waiver for your official MBA application when you are ready to enroll
If admitted, guaranteed admission to the Full-time and Evening MBA programs for 5 years
Invitations to MBA networking events prior to enrolling in the program to build your network
You are eligible to apply for MBA early decision if you meet all of the following requirements:
The admissions committee will consider applications without a GMAT or GRE test score. However, a valid GMAT or GRE score is strongly encouraged for MBA Early Admission for Undergrads candidates.
Submit the following information to apply. All information must be received for consideration:
Complete MBA Early Admission for Undergrads applications received by the application deadline will receive an admissions decision within eight weeks.
Work in an approved, professional position in the public, private, or nonprofit sector for a minimum of two years to enter the Evening MBA or a minimum of three years to enter the Full-time MBA.
Complete the official online MBA application by the Round 1 deadline for the semester you want to enroll.
Confirm your admission through the Full-time or Evening MBA Admitted Student Website and submit your enrollment fee to hold your place in the class.
Your admission offer is eligible for five years after graduation from your undergraduate studies. Your early admission does not require you to apply or ultimately enroll in Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business.
The Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business offers a variety of funding opportunities for the MBA program, including graduate assistantships and fellowships. Submitting your Full-time MBA or Evening MBA application by the Round 1 deadline for the semester you want to enroll in will ensure you receive first consideration for these opportunities.
For more information about funding opportunities for each program, visit the Full-time MBA Tuition and Financing and Evening MBA Tuition and Financing pages.
Thank you for requesting more information about our programs. In the meantime, access our online brochures filled with helpful information about our MBA programs.
Full-time MBA Brochure
Evening MBA Brochure
Executive MBA Brochure
This website uses cookies. For more information review our Cookie Policy

• An application fee waiver for your official MBA application when you are ready to enroll
• If admitted, guaranteed admission to the Full-time and Evening MBA programs for 5 years
• Invitations to MBA networking events prior to enrolling in the program to build your network
• You are in your final year of undergraduate study
• You have a post-graduation employment offer
• You have a valid GMAT or GRE or test-optional essay
• You have attended a Full-time or Evening MBA information session
• You are a U.S. citizen attending an accredited U.S. college or university
• December graduates: Application due February 1
• May graduates: Application due June 1
• August graduates: Application due September 1
• MBA Early Admission for Undergrads application (including a statement of purpose, resume, employment letter, unofficial transcript, and unofficial GMAT or GRE score report)
• Two letters of recommendation (preferably one academic, one professional): Letters of recommendation may be sent via email to mba@scheller.gatech.edu from the recommender
• Submit an essay addressing quantitative readiness if applying test optional. Utilize this essay to highlight the criteria that point to evidence supporting your academic preparedness without a test score. Also include any quantitative experience in your professional and academic history that you believe has equipped you to succeed academically in the MBA program. (2,000 character limit).
• Work in an approved, professional position in the public, private, or nonprofit sector for a minimum of two years to enter the Evening MBA or a minimum of three years to enter the Full-time MBA.
• Complete the official online MBA application by the Round 1 deadline for the semester you want to enroll.
• Confirm your admission through the Full-time or Evening MBA Admitted Student Website and submit your enrollment fee to hold your place in the class.

MBA Early Admission for Undergrads allows undergraduates from institutions nationwide to secure deferred, early decision to the Georgia Tech Scheller Full-time or Evening MBA programs.
MBA Early Admission for Undergrads allows you to plan ahead and secure admission during the final year of your undergraduate studies. Once you are admitted, you will work full-time after graduation, then enroll in our Full-time MBA program or continue working as you enter our Evening MBA program.
Undergraduate students of all disciplines can get a jump start on career plans by gaining early action to Georgia Tech Scheller’s Full-time and Evening MBA programs. Any U.S. citizen attending an accredited U.S. college or university is eligible to apply. 









Learn More About MBA Early Admission for Undergrads
The MBA Early Admission for Undergrads program allows students from colleges and universities worldwide to secure deferred or early decision to the Georgia Tech Scheller Full-time or Evening MBA programs. 






Play Video




















Close Video



Video loading













Why Pursue MBA Early Action?


Your undergraduate degree prepares you for the working world, and an MBA will leverage your work experience to broaden your knowledge, give you a competitive advantage in the job market, and help grow your career more quickly.






MBA Early Action Benefits


MBA Early Admission for Undergrads applicants receive:


An application fee waiver for your official MBA application when you are ready to enroll


If admitted, guaranteed admission to the Full-time and Evening MBA programs for 5 years


Invitations to MBA networking events prior to enrolling in the program to build your network



















Early Admission Eligibility



You are eligible to apply for MBA early decision if you meet all of the following requirements:

You are in your final year of undergraduate study
You have a post-graduation employment offer
You have a valid GMAT or GRE or test-optional essay 
You have attended a Full-time or Evening MBA information session
You are a U.S. citizen attending an accredited U.S. college or university

The admissions committee will consider applications without a GMAT or GRE test score. However, a valid GMAT or GRE score is strongly encouraged for MBA Early Admission for Undergrads candidates.






Application and Admissions



Application Deadlines

December graduates: Application due February 1
May graduates: Application due June 1
August graduates: Application due September 1

How to Apply
Submit the following information to apply. All information must be received for consideration:

MBA Early Admission for Undergrads application (including a statement of purpose, resume, employment letter, unofficial transcript, and unofficial GMAT or GRE score report)
Two letters of recommendation (preferably one academic, one professional): Letters of recommendation may be sent via email to mba@scheller.gatech.edu from the recommender 
Submit an essay addressing quantitative readiness if applying test optional. Utilize this essay to highlight the criteria that point to evidence supporting your academic preparedness without a test score. Also include any quantitative experience in your professional and academic history that you believe has equipped you to succeed academically in the MBA program. (2,000 character limit).

Complete MBA Early Admission for Undergrads applications received by the application deadline will receive an admissions decision within eight weeks.
Submit Your Application






Admitted Student Requirements





Work in an approved, professional position in the public, private, or nonprofit sector for a minimum of two years to enter the Evening MBA or a minimum of three years to enter the Full-time MBA.


Complete the official online MBA application by the Round 1 deadline for the semester you want to enroll.


Confirm your admission through the Full-time or Evening MBA Admitted Student Website and submit your enrollment fee to hold your place in the class.


Your admission offer is eligible for five years after graduation from your undergraduate studies. Your early admission does not require you to apply or ultimately enroll in Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business.






Financing Your MBA



The Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business offers a variety of funding opportunities for the MBA program, including graduate assistantships and fellowships. Submitting your Full-time MBA or Evening MBA application by the Round 1 deadline for the semester you want to enroll in will ensure you receive first consideration for these opportunities.
For more information about funding opportunities for each program, visit the Full-time MBA Tuition and Financing and Evening MBA Tuition and Financing pages.

Your admission offer is eligible for five years after graduation from your undergraduate studies. Your early admission does not require you to apply or ultimately enroll in Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business.






Financing Your MBA



The Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business offers a variety of funding opportunities for the MBA program, including graduate assistantships and fellowships. Submitting your Full-time MBA or Evening MBA application by the Round 1 deadline for the semester you want to enroll in will ensure you receive first consideration for these opportunities.
For more information about funding opportunities for each program, visit the Full-time MBA Tuition and Financing and Evening MBA Tuition and Financing pages.

Your undergraduate degree prepares you for the working world, and an MBA will leverage your work experience to broaden your knowledge, give you a competitive advantage in the job market, and help grow your career more quickly.






MBA Early Action Benefits


MBA Early Admission for Undergrads applicants receive:


An application fee waiver for your official MBA application when you are ready to enroll


If admitted, guaranteed admission to the Full-time and Evening MBA programs for 5 years


Invitations to MBA networking events prior to enrolling in the program to build your network

[HEADING] M.D./MBA Program
[HEADING] What is an M.D./MBA Dual Degree
[HEADING] Why Pursue an M.D./MBA Degree?

[HEADING] Application & Admissions

[HEADING] Tuition & Financing
[HEADING] Tuition
[HEADING] Financing
The Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business and Morehouse School of Medicine (MSM) have partnered to offer an M.D./MBA program. Pairing an MBA with an M.D. degree gives students a unique blend of skills to advance their careers. M.D./MBAs are able to complete their MBA in one year while enrolled in the M.D. program.
Students who are enrolled in the M.D. program at the Morehouse School of Medicine are eligible to apply to the Full-time MBA program and should plan to apply prior to the end of their third year in the M.D. program.
Morehouse School of Medicine students must apply to and be accepted by the MBA Admissions Office.
M.D./MBA students take 39 credit hours at Scheller and transfer 15 credits of specific courses from the M.D. program at the Morehouse School of Medicine to complete the 54 credits of the MBA curriculum at Scheller. With a higher course load per semester than those who pursue a single degree, students can complete both the M.D. and the MBA degrees in five years.
During the first three years, students will take M.D. courses at Morehouse School of Medicine. During the fourth year, students will take 39 credit hours of MBA courses at Scheller.
Summer semester
* Students can choose to take MGT 6510 in the spring semester
MSM M.D. students can apply by any of the Full-time MBA deadlines. However, applying in Rounds 1 or 2 maximizes an applicant's consideration for merit-based scholarships.
Admission to the Full-time MBA program is competitive and will depend on academic background, career goals, fit with the MBA program, test scores, application essays, and leadership potential. In addition to submitting the standard online MBA application, the MBA admissions process will include an in-person interview. MSM M.D. students may submit MCAT scores (in lieu of GMAT/GRE scores) for admission.
M.D./MBA Special Application Instructions:
MSM M.D./MBA students will be enrolled at Georgia Tech during their fourth year and will pay the applicable Full-time MBA tuition and fees to Georgia Tech for that academic year.
The cost includes 12+ credit hours per semester for the academic year. The academic year includes Fall and Spring semesters. During the Summer semester, students will pay the Full-time MBA per credit hour rate for the remaining six credits.
During the first three years of the M.D. program, students will be enrolled at Morehouse School of Medicine and will not be enrolled at Scheller.
Scheller offers a variety of funding opportunities for the MBA program. Submitting the official MBA application by the Round 1 or Round 2 deadlines maximizes an applicant's chances for consideration of merit-based scholarships.

What is an M.D./MBA Dual Degree





The Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business and Morehouse School of Medicine (MSM) have partnered to offer an M.D./MBA program. Pairing an MBA with an M.D. degree gives students a unique blend of skills to advance their careers. M.D./MBAs are able to complete their MBA in one year while enrolled in the M.D. program. 
The program allows students to count 15 credit hours from their MSM M.D. degree courses toward their MBA elective requirements, reducing the cost and time required to complete the MBA degree.
                                                    












Why Pursue an M.D./MBA Degree?



Develop business acumen, strategic thinking, and communication skills to progress in leadership roles at healthcare companies, insurance companies, and government organizations.
Acquire skills and knowledge to manage a future medical practice as a business and to become a more effective medical practitioner.
Prepare to effectively participate in healthcare-focused entrepreneurial ventures.
Transfer M.D. credit hours and reduce the time required to complete an MBA degree.







Why Pursue an MBA from Scheller?



The Georgia Tech Scheller MBA program is nationally ranked and globally recognized.
Complete your MBA while enrolled in the M.D. program, without interrupting your career later.
Focusingon applied learning prepares you to compete effectively in the technology-enabled healthcare ecosystem of the future.
Scheller's location in Tech Square offers an unparalleled opportunity to learn and interact with Fortune 500 innovation centers, startups, and more. 















MBA Dual Degree Info FAQ







Eligibility




Students who are enrolled in the M.D. program at the Morehouse School of Medicine are eligible to apply to the Full-time MBA program and should plan to apply prior to the end of their third year in the M.D. program. 
Morehouse School of Medicine students must apply to and be accepted by the MBA Admissions Office.







Program Structure



M.D./MBA students take 39 credit hours at Scheller and transfer 15 credits of specific courses from the M.D. program at the Morehouse School of Medicine to complete the 54 credits of the MBA curriculum at Scheller. With a higher course load per semester than those who pursue a single degree, students can complete both the M.D. and the MBA degrees in five years. 
During the first three years, students will take M.D. courses at Morehouse School of Medicine. During the fourth year, students will take 39 credit hours of MBA courses at Scheller.

Application & Admissions



Morehouse School of Medicine students must apply to and be accepted by the MBA Admissions Office. 
MSM M.D. students can apply by any of the Full-time MBA deadlines. However, applying in Rounds 1 or 2 maximizes an applicant's consideration for merit-based scholarships.
Admission to the Full-time MBA program is competitive and will depend on academic background, career goals, fit with the MBA program, test scores, application essays, and leadership potential. In addition to submitting the standard online MBA application, the MBA admissions process will include an in-person interview. MSM M.D. students may submit MCAT scores (in lieu of GMAT/GRE scores) for admission.
M.D./MBA Special Application Instructions:

When starting the application, select “Business Administration (Full-time MBA)" under "Program Selection."
Within the "MBA Supplemental Dual Degree" section, select “Yes” as a dual degree applicant, and select Morehouse College and M.D. in the appropriate dropdown choices.
In the Academic History section, be sure to select Morehouse School of Medicine and Doctor of Medicine.
In the unofficial GMAT section of the application, please input your MCAT scores.

Application Requirements






Tuition & Financing



Tuition
MSM M.D./MBA students will be enrolled at Georgia Tech during their fourth year and will pay the applicable Full-time MBA tuition and fees to Georgia Tech for that academic year.
The cost includes 12+ credit hours per semester for the academic year. The academic year includes Fall and Spring semesters. During the Summer semester, students will pay the Full-time MBA per credit hour rate for the remaining six credits. 
During the first three years of the M.D. program, students will be enrolled at Morehouse School of Medicine and will not be enrolled at Scheller. 
Financing
Scheller offers a variety of funding opportunities for the MBA program. Submitting the official MBA application by the Round 1 or Round 2 deadlines maximizes an applicant's chances for consideration of merit-based scholarships.

MBA Dual Degree Info FAQ
Eligibility




Students who are enrolled in the M.D. program at the Morehouse School of Medicine are eligible to apply to the Full-time MBA program and should plan to apply prior to the end of their third year in the M.D. program. 
Morehouse School of Medicine students must apply to and be accepted by the MBA Admissions Office.







Program Structure



M.D./MBA students take 39 credit hours at Scheller and transfer 15 credits of specific courses from the M.D. program at the Morehouse School of Medicine to complete the 54 credits of the MBA curriculum at Scheller. With a higher course load per semester than those who pursue a single degree, students can complete both the M.D. and the MBA degrees in five years. 
During the first three years, students will take M.D. courses at Morehouse School of Medicine. During the fourth year, students will take 39 credit hours of MBA courses at Scheller. 
The sequence of M.D./MBA Courses





Semester

M.D. program courses only at Morehouse School of Medicine

Application & Admissions



Morehouse School of Medicine students must apply to and be accepted by the MBA Admissions Office. 
MSM M.D. students can apply by any of the Full-time MBA deadlines. However, applying in Rounds 1 or 2 maximizes an applicant's consideration for merit-based scholarships.
Admission to the Full-time MBA program is competitive and will depend on academic background, career goals, fit with the MBA program, test scores, application essays, and leadership potential. In addition to submitting the standard online MBA application, the MBA admissions process will include an in-person interview. MSM M.D. students may submit MCAT scores (in lieu of GMAT/GRE scores) for admission.
M.D./MBA Special Application Instructions:

When starting the application, select “Business Administration (Full-time MBA)" under "Program Selection."
Within the "MBA Supplemental Dual Degree" section, select “Yes” as a dual degree applicant, and select Morehouse College and M.D. in the appropriate dropdown choices.
In the Academic History section, be sure to select Morehouse School of Medicine and Doctor of Medicine.
In the unofficial GMAT section of the application, please input your MCAT scores.

Application Requirements






Tuition & Financing



Tuition
MSM M.D./MBA students will be enrolled at Georgia Tech during their fourth year and will pay the applicable Full-time MBA tuition and fees to Georgia Tech for that academic year.
The cost includes 12+ credit hours per semester for the academic year. The academic year includes Fall and Spring semesters. During the Summer semester, students will pay the Full-time MBA per credit hour rate for the remaining six credits. 
During the first three years of the M.D. program, students will be enrolled at Morehouse School of Medicine and will not be enrolled at Scheller. 
Financing
Scheller offers a variety of funding opportunities for the MBA program. Submitting the official MBA application by the Round 1 or Round 2 deadlines maximizes an applicant's chances for consideration of merit-based scholarships.

What is an M.D./MBA Dual Degree
The Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business and Morehouse School of Medicine (MSM) have partnered to offer an M.D./MBA program. Pairing an MBA with an M.D. degree gives students a unique blend of skills to advance their careers. M.D./MBAs are able to complete their MBA in one year while enrolled in the M.D. program. 
The program allows students to count 15 credit hours from their MSM M.D. degree courses toward their MBA elective requirements, reducing the cost and time required to complete the MBA degree.
Why Pursue an M.D./MBA Degree?



Develop business acumen, strategic thinking, and communication skills to progress in leadership roles at healthcare companies, insurance companies, and government organizations.
Acquire skills and knowledge to manage a future medical practice as a business and to become a more effective medical practitioner.
Prepare to effectively participate in healthcare-focused entrepreneurial ventures.
Transfer M.D. credit hours and reduce the time required to complete an MBA degree.







Why Pursue an MBA from Scheller?



The Georgia Tech Scheller MBA program is nationally ranked and globally recognized.
Complete your MBA while enrolled in the M.D. program, without interrupting your career later.
Focusingon applied learning prepares you to compete effectively in the technology-enabled healthcare ecosystem of the future.
Scheller's location in Tech Square offers an unparalleled opportunity to learn and interact with Fortune 500 innovation centers, startups, and more.

Acquire skills and knowledge to manage a future medical practice as a business and to become a more effective medical practitioner.
Prepare to effectively participate in healthcare-focused entrepreneurial ventures.
Transfer M.D. credit hours and reduce the time required to complete an MBA degree.
Why Pursue an M.D./MBA Degree?
Why Pursue an MBA from Scheller?



The Georgia Tech Scheller MBA program is nationally ranked and globally recognized.
Complete your MBA while enrolled in the M.D. program, without interrupting your career later.
Focusingon applied learning prepares you to compete effectively in the technology-enabled healthcare ecosystem of the future.
Scheller's location in Tech Square offers an unparalleled opportunity to learn and interact with Fortune 500 innovation centers, startups, and more.
Why Pursue an MBA from Scheller?



The Georgia Tech Scheller MBA program is nationally ranked and globally recognized.
Complete your MBA while enrolled in the M.D. program, without interrupting your career later.
Focusingon applied learning prepares you to compete effectively in the technology-enabled healthcare ecosystem of the future.
Scheller's location in Tech Square offers an unparalleled opportunity to learn and interact with Fortune 500 innovation centers, startups, and more.

[HEADING] Executive MBA FAQs
[HEADING] Commonly Asked Questions
[HEADING] Program Information
[HEADING] What is the Georgia Tech Executive MBA format?
[HEADING] What is the difference between Executive, Evening, and Full-time MBA programs?
[HEADING] What are the differences between the Global Business and Management of Technology specializations?
[HEADING] Where are Executive MBA classes held?
[HEADING] What is the profile of a typical student?
[HEADING] What career advancement outcomes can I expect from the Executive MBA program?
[HEADING] Do you have to live or work in Atlanta to participate in either EMBA program?
[HEADING] How big is the class?
[HEADING] What happens during the international residency?
[HEADING] What will my diploma say?
[HEADING] How many hours do students spend on work outside of class?
[HEADING] Is the program offered online?
[HEADING] When does the program begin?
[HEADING] Will I have access to Georgia Tech resources?
[HEADING] How big is the alumni network?
[HEADING] Can I attend a class session to experience the program firsthand?
[HEADING] Admissions
[HEADING] What are the admission requirements?
[HEADING] How do I apply?
[HEADING] When is the application deadline?
[HEADING] Do I have to take the GMAT, GMAT Focus, GRE, or Executive Assessment?
[HEADING] Does my work experience need to be as a manager?
[HEADING] Do I need to have an undergraduate degree?
[HEADING] How many people typically apply to the Executive MBA program?
[HEADING] Will I be interviewed?
[HEADING] When will I know if I have been accepted?
[HEADING] Whom may I contact if I have more questions?
[HEADING] Tuition and Financing
[HEADING] How much does the program cost and what does tuition cover?
[HEADING] Is my company required to sponsor me during the program?

[HEADING] Is there financial aid available?
[HEADING] Directions, Parking, and Accommodations

[HEADING] Are there hotels near campus?
[HEADING] Tell me more about Tech Square and Atlanta.
We have compiled a selection of the questions prospective Georgia Tech Executive MBA students most commonly ask. If you are unable to find the answer to a specific question or wish to speak with someone directly regarding other questions, feel free to contact us online or call 404.385.2254. To read more about MBA programs check out our Why an MBA resources.
The Executive MBA (EMBA) format is designed for working professionals with a minimum of five years of progressive career experience. You do not have to be at an executive level to participate in the EMBA program. Our EMBA students average 10 - 15 years of work experience and are seeking a MBA that specifically focuses on the knowledge and skill sets they need to advance their careers or move into new career paths.
The EMBA format also offers a more enhanced level of service than most MBA programs. As a student, you gain access to a program team that handles administrative tasks and provides support during your onboarding process and throughout your 17 months as a student.
EMBA students move through the program as a cohort, beginning the 17-month program with a weeklong residency at Georgia Tech. Students then attend classes approximately two to three weekends a month on select Friday evenings (5:30 - 9:30 p.m.) and Saturdays (8:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.) for the duration of the program. There are no Sunday classes. There is an additional on-campus weeklong residency in December of the first semester and a mandatory two-week international residency.
Executive, Evening, and Full-time MBA designations refer to the format of the classes/program, not to the MBA degree itself. It is important to note that students who enroll in the Executive MBA program earn MBA degrees, not “Executive MBA” degrees. Upon completion of the Executive MBA program, students are awarded either an “MBA - Global Business” degree or an “MBA - Management of Technology” degree, depending on which degree specialty they select.
Both programs share a core MBA curriculum that all EMBA students, regardless of program specialty, must complete.
Global Business (Leadership)
The Global Business (Leadership) specialization teaches you to think strategically and contribute to companies that work across borders and around the world. After the EMBA core, Global Business (Leadership) transitions to a specialized curriculum focusing on the dynamics of global competition and strategies for building a global competitive advantage.
The Global Strategy Project is the program's capstone experience – where you and your capstone team will work with a company to address an actual issue on a global scale. You’ll identify opportunities and make recommendations on how to implement strategies internationally, from product and pricing to procurement, logistics, and management. Learn more about the Global Business (Leadership) specialization.
Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship)
The Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship) specialization teaches you to forecast and embrace emerging technologies, all while managing innovation and organizational change.
The Management of Technology Project is the program's capstone project. As a member of a select team, you’ll choose an emerging technology and complete a full business plan, demonstrating your understanding of how to take a technology-driven product or service to market. This powerful integrative experience concludes with a juried business plan competition. Learn more about the Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship) specialization.
Classes are held in the state-of-the-art Huang Executive Education Center in the Scheller College of Business, located at the corner of West Peachtree Street and Fifth Street in Technology Square, Midtown Atlanta.
Qualified candidates have several years of professional work experience (a minimum of five years is required) with a history of professional advancement and leadership. Students' personal and professional backgrounds vary, bringing diversity to the classroom experience.
Our Executive MBA students report an average 20% salary increase from program start to graduation.
No. Though many students reside in Georgia, some students commute from other states. Travel expenses and accommodations for the domestic residencies and classes are not included in the cost of the program, but we will gladly provide you with a list of local lodging options.
Each degree program has approximately 70 - 80 students per cohort.
Students visit businesses and educational institutions in established and emerging economies during the international residency.  You’ll examine the cultural, legal, and economic aspects of each location you visit, gaining deeper, firsthand knowledge of international business practices and cultures. Ultimately, you’ll gain an understanding of the country’s economy and how to effectively conduct business there.
Global Business (Leadership) students also have the opportunity to participate in an optional second international residency.
Depending on which of our two degrees you pursue, you will receive one of the following:
On average, students spend between 10 and 20 hours per week on assignments outside of class. This number will vary based on how familiar you are with the courses taught in a given semester.
At this time, we do not offer this program online.
Each cohort begins in August and graduates the following December.
Yes, you will have access to all student resources. One of the key differentiators of our program is the fact you experience your program on a diverse and complete college campus. Whether it is the library resources, the recreation center, or cheering for Division I-A sports teams, you are a full member of the Georgia Tech campus community.
The EMBA alumni network is more than 2,000 strong. In addition, the Georgia Tech and Scheller College of Business networks have hundreds of thousands of loyal members.
We will be happy to schedule a class visit for you to one of our EMBA classes. We request that you first attend one of our information sessions or submit your current resume for review to us at emba@gatech.edu. Upon completion of either of these requests, we will contact you to arrange a class visit that meets your schedule.
You will need to begin your application here. You are required to select your Executive MBA specialization at the time of application. We recommend you plan for one hour to complete your application.
For questions on the admissions process, the admissions team is here to assist you every step of the way. To connect with a member of the admissions team, please email us at emba@gatech.edu, call at 404.385.2254, or schedule a one-on-one consultation.
Applicants are admitted on a rolling admissions basis, with applications processed as they are submitted for the incoming class. We highly recommend submitting your application as early as possible to ensure your placement in the program. Class seats are awarded on a first-come, first-served basis. See application deadlines.
The Executive MBA program has a test-optional admissions policy. Any applicant who can demonstrate strong quantitative skills through their academic and professional work experience is welcome to apply without a test score. Prospective students do not have to meet certain criteria in order to pursue this option.
Your work experience should be in a professional setting, but you do not need to have managed people to apply.
Yes. You must have a four-year degree from a regionally accredited institution to apply. For international students, you must have a four-year degree equivalent.
We typically seat a class of 70 - 80 students each start, with about twice as many students applying. We prescreen applicants, so unqualified students typically remove themselves from the process and do not officially apply to the program.
Yes, each qualified applicant will be invited for a one-hour admissions interview as part of the application process.
The admissions process typically takes two to four weeks after we have received your completed application and have conducted your admissions interview.
Please contact the Executive MBA admissions team at 404.385.2254 or via email at emba@gatech.edu to learn more.
The program fee for the class is $84,563 (subject to change). This includes all textbooks, classroom materials, access to campus resources; on-ground costs for the international residency; on-campus parking across from the Scheller College of Business building; executive coaching, career development programs, and lifetime executive coaching for alumni; food and refreshments during scheduled class times; and admission to guest speaker events, symposia, and lectures.
Your company is not required to sponsor you financially or submit a letter of company support for your enrollment. We do suggest you discuss the time commitment required for the program and your program goals with your employer. This is an excellent way of positioning yourself for future opportunities within your company if your goal is advancement within your organization.
Yes. We award a limited number of fellowships to Executive MBA students. Applicants who apply early receive first consideration. No additional application materials are required.
Yes. There are numerous financial aid options for which you may be eligible. To learn more, please visit finaid.gatech.edu for more information.
View detailed directions and parking.
Many visitors take MARTA (light rail) from the airport. There are two MARTA stations (North Avenue and Midtown) within blocks of the College and there are a variety of hotels and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.
There are many other options for traveling to and from Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport to Midtown Atlanta.
Yes. There are many hotels to choose from near the College of Business and the Georgia Tech campus. Here are several options:(ask for Georgia Tech rates)Georgia Tech Hotel and Conference Center (across the street from Scheller College of Business)800 Spring Street NW, Atlanta, GA 30308Reservations: 404-347-9440; 800-706-2899This full-service hotel located on the Georgia Tech campus, offers restaurant, bar and room service seven days a week as well as numerous restaurant options just steps away. The hotel also features free wireless internet, fitness center (including indoor pool) and FREE transportation on the Tech. Ask for the Georgia Tech Rate!
Many of the hotels listed below also offer Georgia Tech rates. Be sure to ask!
Georgian Terrace (.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)659 Peachtree StreetAtlanta, GA 30308404-897-1991
Hilton Garden Inn/Homewood Suites (0.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)97 10th Street NWAtlanta, GA 30309404-524-4006
Hotel Indigo Atlanta Midtown (.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)683 Peachtree Street. NE Atlanta, GA 30308404-874-9200
Home2 Suites (.3 miles from the Scheller College of Business)975 West Peachtree St. NW, Atlanta, GA 30309800-642-3629
Renaissance Atlanta Hotel Downtown (.1 mile walk from Scheller College of Business)866 West Peachtree Street NW Atlanta, GA 30308678-412-2400
Residence Inn Atlanta Midtown / Historic (.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)1041 West Peachtree StreetAtlanta, GA 30309404-872-8885
Residence Inn Midtown/17th at Peachtree hotel (1.2 miles from Scheller College of Business)1365 W Peachtree St NEAtlanta, GA 30309404-745-1000

We have compiled a selection of the questions prospective Georgia Tech Executive MBA students most commonly ask. If you are unable to find the answer to a specific question or wish to speak with someone directly regarding other questions, feel free to contact us online or call 404.385.2254. To read more about MBA programs check out our Why an MBA resources.









Commonly Asked Questions







Program Information



What is the Georgia Tech Executive MBA format?
The Executive MBA (EMBA) format is designed for working professionals with a minimum of five years of progressive career experience. You do not have to be at an executive level to participate in the EMBA program. Our EMBA students average 10 - 15 years of work experience and are seeking a MBA that specifically focuses on the knowledge and skill sets they need to advance their careers or move into new career paths.
The EMBA format also offers a more enhanced level of service than most MBA programs. As a student, you gain access to a program team that handles administrative tasks and provides support during your onboarding process and throughout your 17 months as a student.
EMBA students move through the program as a cohort, beginning the 17-month program with a weeklong residency at Georgia Tech. Students then attend classes approximately two to three weekends a month on select Friday evenings (5:30 - 9:30 p.m.) and Saturdays (8:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.) for the duration of the program. There are no Sunday classes. There is an additional on-campus weeklong residency in December of the first semester and a mandatory two-week international residency.

Executive, Evening, and Full-time MBA designations refer to the format of the classes/program, not to the MBA degree itself. It is important to note that students who enroll in the Executive MBA program earn MBA degrees, not “Executive MBA” degrees. Upon completion of the Executive MBA program, students are awarded either an “MBA - Global Business” degree or an “MBA - Management of Technology” degree, depending on which degree specialty they select.

Both programs share a core MBA curriculum that all EMBA students, regardless of program specialty, must complete.
Global Business (Leadership)
The Global Business (Leadership) specialization teaches you to think strategically and contribute to companies that work across borders and around the world. After the EMBA core, Global Business (Leadership) transitions to a specialized curriculum focusing on the dynamics of global competition and strategies for building a global competitive advantage. 
The Global Strategy Project is the program's capstone experience – where you and your capstone team will work with a company to address an actual issue on a global scale. You’ll identify opportunities and make recommendations on how to implement strategies internationally, from product and pricing to procurement, logistics, and management. Learn more about the Global Business (Leadership) specialization.
Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship)
The Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship) specialization teaches you to forecast and embrace emerging technologies, all while managing innovation and organizational change. 
The Management of Technology Project is the program's capstone project. As a member of a select team, you’ll choose an emerging technology and complete a full business plan, demonstrating your understanding of how to take a technology-driven product or service to market. This powerful integrative experience concludes with a juried business plan competition. Learn more about the Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship) specialization.
Where are Executive MBA classes held?
Classes are held in the state-of-the-art Huang Executive Education Center in the Scheller College of Business, located at the corner of West Peachtree Street and Fifth Street in Technology Square, Midtown Atlanta.
What is the profile of a typical student?
Qualified candidates have several years of professional work experience (a minimum of five years is required) with a history of professional advancement and leadership. Students' personal and professional backgrounds vary, bringing diversity to the classroom experience.
What career advancement outcomes can I expect from the Executive MBA program?
Our Executive MBA students report an average 20% salary increase from program start to graduation. 
Do you have to live or work in Atlanta to participate in either EMBA program?
No. Though many students reside in Georgia, some students commute from other states. Travel expenses and accommodations for the domestic residencies and classes are not included in the cost of the program, but we will gladly provide you with a list of local lodging options.
How big is the class?
Each degree program has approximately 70 - 80 students per cohort. 
What happens during the international residency?
Students visit businesses and educational institutions in established and emerging economies during the international residency.  You’ll examine the cultural, legal, and economic aspects of each location you visit, gaining deeper, firsthand knowledge of international business practices and cultures. Ultimately, you’ll gain an understanding of the country’s economy and how to effectively conduct business there.
Global Business (Leadership) students also have the opportunity to participate in an optional second international residency. 
What will my diploma say?
Depending on which of our two degrees you pursue, you will receive one of the following:

Master of Business Administration – Global Business
Master of Business Administration – Management of Technology

How many hours do students spend on work outside of class?
On average, students spend between 10 and 20 hours per week on assignments outside of class. This number will vary based on how familiar you are with the courses taught in a given semester.
Is the program offered online?
At this time, we do not offer this program online.
When does the program begin?
Each cohort begins in August and graduates the following December. 
Will I have access to Georgia Tech resources?
Yes, you will have access to all student resources. One of the key differentiators of our program is the fact you experience your program on a diverse and complete college campus. Whether it is the library resources, the recreation center, or cheering for Division I-A sports teams, you are a full member of the Georgia Tech campus community.
How big is the alumni network?
The EMBA alumni network is more than 2,000 strong. In addition, the Georgia Tech and Scheller College of Business networks have hundreds of thousands of loyal members. 
Can I attend a class session to experience the program firsthand?
We will be happy to schedule a class visit for you to one of our EMBA classes. We request that you first attend one of our information sessions or submit your current resume for review to us at emba@gatech.edu. Upon completion of either of these requests, we will contact you to arrange a class visit that meets your schedule.






Admissions



What are the admission requirements?

Working professional with a minimum of five years of full-time career experience
Four-year bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Online application

Academic transcripts from all previous institutions
Current resume
Required essays (2): 

Why an MBA and why the Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business? Describe how your experience, both professional and personal, has led you to the decision to pursue an MBA at Georgia Tech. Discuss your short- and long-term career goals and how Scheller is best suited to help you achieve your goals (2,000 characters max).
List 10 facts about yourself that will help your future classmates get to know you.


Professional letters of recommendation (2)


Admissions interview
Official TOEFL score (if required)

How do I apply?
You will need to begin your application here. You are required to select your Executive MBA specialization at the time of application. We recommend you plan for one hour to complete your application.
For questions on the admissions process, the admissions team is here to assist you every step of the way. To connect with a member of the admissions team, please email us at emba@gatech.edu, call at 404.385.2254, or schedule a one-on-one consultation. 
When is the application deadline?
Applicants are admitted on a rolling admissions basis, with applications processed as they are submitted for the incoming class. We highly recommend submitting your application as early as possible to ensure your placement in the program. Class seats are awarded on a first-come, first-served basis. See application deadlines. 
Do I have to take the GMAT, GMAT Focus, GRE, or Executive Assessment?
The Executive MBA program has a test-optional admissions policy. Any applicant who can demonstrate strong quantitative skills through their academic and professional work experience is welcome to apply without a test score. Prospective students do not have to meet certain criteria in order to pursue this option.
Does my work experience need to be as a manager?
Your work experience should be in a professional setting, but you do not need to have managed people to apply.
Do I need to have an undergraduate degree?
Yes. You must have a four-year degree from a regionally accredited institution to apply. For international students, you must have a four-year degree equivalent.
How many people typically apply to the Executive MBA program?
We typically seat a class of 70 - 80 students each start, with about twice as many students applying. We prescreen applicants, so unqualified students typically remove themselves from the process and do not officially apply to the program.
Will I be interviewed?
Yes, each qualified applicant will be invited for a one-hour admissions interview as part of the application process.
When will I know if I have been accepted?
The admissions process typically takes two to four weeks after we have received your completed application and have conducted your admissions interview.
Whom may I contact if I have more questions?
Please contact the Executive MBA admissions team at 404.385.2254 or via email at emba@gatech.edu to learn more.






Tuition and Financing



How much does the program cost and what does tuition cover?
The program fee for the class is $84,563 (subject to change). This includes all textbooks, classroom materials, access to campus resources; on-ground costs for the international residency; on-campus parking across from the Scheller College of Business building; executive coaching, career development programs, and lifetime executive coaching for alumni; food and refreshments during scheduled class times; and admission to guest speaker events, symposia, and lectures.
Is my company required to sponsor me during the program?
Your company is not required to sponsor you financially or submit a letter of company support for your enrollment. We do suggest you discuss the time commitment required for the program and your program goals with your employer. This is an excellent way of positioning yourself for future opportunities within your company if your goal is advancement within your organization. 
Are scholarships available? 
Yes. We award a limited number of fellowships to Executive MBA students. Applicants who apply early receive first consideration. No additional application materials are required.
Is there financial aid available?
Yes. There are numerous financial aid options for which you may be eligible. To learn more, please visit finaid.gatech.edu for more information.






Directions, Parking, and Accommodations



How do I get to the Scheller College of Business?
View detailed directions and parking.
How do I get from the airport to the College?
Many visitors take MARTA (light rail) from the airport. There are two MARTA stations (North Avenue and Midtown) within blocks of the College and there are a variety of hotels and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.
There are many other options for traveling to and from Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport to Midtown Atlanta.
Are there hotels near campus?
Yes. There are many hotels to choose from near the College of Business and the Georgia Tech campus. Here are several options:(ask for Georgia Tech rates)Georgia Tech Hotel and Conference Center (across the street from Scheller College of Business)800 Spring Street NW, Atlanta, GA 30308Reservations: 404-347-9440; 800-706-2899This full-service hotel located on the Georgia Tech campus, offers restaurant, bar and room service seven days a week as well as numerous restaurant options just steps away. The hotel also features free wireless internet, fitness center (including indoor pool) and FREE transportation on the Tech. Ask for the Georgia Tech Rate!
Many of the hotels listed below also offer Georgia Tech rates. Be sure to ask!
Georgian Terrace (.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)659 Peachtree StreetAtlanta, GA 30308404-897-1991

Learn more about Tech Square and Atlanta.




























Thank you for requesting more information about our programs. In the meantime, access our online brochures filled with helpful information about our MBA programs.
 Full-time MBA Brochure 
 Evening MBA Brochure 
 Executive MBA Brochure
We have compiled a selection of the questions prospective Georgia Tech Executive MBA students most commonly ask. If you are unable to find the answer to a specific question or wish to speak with someone directly regarding other questions, feel free to contact us online or call 404.385.2254. To read more about MBA programs check out our Why an MBA resources.
Commonly Asked Questions
Program Information



What is the Georgia Tech Executive MBA format?
The Executive MBA (EMBA) format is designed for working professionals with a minimum of five years of progressive career experience. You do not have to be at an executive level to participate in the EMBA program. Our EMBA students average 10 - 15 years of work experience and are seeking a MBA that specifically focuses on the knowledge and skill sets they need to advance their careers or move into new career paths.
The EMBA format also offers a more enhanced level of service than most MBA programs. As a student, you gain access to a program team that handles administrative tasks and provides support during your onboarding process and throughout your 17 months as a student.
EMBA students move through the program as a cohort, beginning the 17-month program with a weeklong residency at Georgia Tech. Students then attend classes approximately two to three weekends a month on select Friday evenings (5:30 - 9:30 p.m.) and Saturdays (8:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.) for the duration of the program. There are no Sunday classes. There is an additional on-campus weeklong residency in December of the first semester and a mandatory two-week international residency.
What is the difference between Executive, Evening, and Full-time MBA programs?
Executive, Evening, and Full-time MBA designations refer to the format of the classes/program, not to the MBA degree itself. It is important to note that students who enroll in the Executive MBA program earn MBA degrees, not “Executive MBA” degrees. Upon completion of the Executive MBA program, students are awarded either an “MBA - Global Business” degree or an “MBA - Management of Technology” degree, depending on which degree specialty they select.
What are the differences between the Global Business and Management of Technology specializations?
Both programs share a core MBA curriculum that all EMBA students, regardless of program specialty, must complete.
Global Business (Leadership)
The Global Business (Leadership) specialization teaches you to think strategically and contribute to companies that work across borders and around the world. After the EMBA core, Global Business (Leadership) transitions to a specialized curriculum focusing on the dynamics of global competition and strategies for building a global competitive advantage. 
The Global Strategy Project is the program's capstone experience – where you and your capstone team will work with a company to address an actual issue on a global scale. You’ll identify opportunities and make recommendations on how to implement strategies internationally, from product and pricing to procurement, logistics, and management. Learn more about the Global Business (Leadership) specialization.
Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship)
The Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship) specialization teaches you to forecast and embrace emerging technologies, all while managing innovation and organizational change. 
The Management of Technology Project is the program's capstone project. As a member of a select team, you’ll choose an emerging technology and complete a full business plan, demonstrating your understanding of how to take a technology-driven product or service to market. This powerful integrative experience concludes with a juried business plan competition. Learn more about the Management of Technology (Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Intrapreneurship) specialization.
Where are Executive MBA classes held?
Classes are held in the state-of-the-art Huang Executive Education Center in the Scheller College of Business, located at the corner of West Peachtree Street and Fifth Street in Technology Square, Midtown Atlanta.
What is the profile of a typical student?
Qualified candidates have several years of professional work experience (a minimum of five years is required) with a history of professional advancement and leadership. Students' personal and professional backgrounds vary, bringing diversity to the classroom experience.
What career advancement outcomes can I expect from the Executive MBA program?
Our Executive MBA students report an average 20% salary increase from program start to graduation. 
Do you have to live or work in Atlanta to participate in either EMBA program?
No. Though many students reside in Georgia, some students commute from other states. Travel expenses and accommodations for the domestic residencies and classes are not included in the cost of the program, but we will gladly provide you with a list of local lodging options.
How big is the class?
Each degree program has approximately 70 - 80 students per cohort. 
What happens during the international residency?
Students visit businesses and educational institutions in established and emerging economies during the international residency.  You’ll examine the cultural, legal, and economic aspects of each location you visit, gaining deeper, firsthand knowledge of international business practices and cultures. Ultimately, you’ll gain an understanding of the country’s economy and how to effectively conduct business there.
Global Business (Leadership) students also have the opportunity to participate in an optional second international residency. 
What will my diploma say?
Depending on which of our two degrees you pursue, you will receive one of the following:

Master of Business Administration – Global Business
Master of Business Administration – Management of Technology

How many hours do students spend on work outside of class?
On average, students spend between 10 and 20 hours per week on assignments outside of class. This number will vary based on how familiar you are with the courses taught in a given semester.
Is the program offered online?
At this time, we do not offer this program online.
When does the program begin?
Each cohort begins in August and graduates the following December. 
Will I have access to Georgia Tech resources?
Yes, you will have access to all student resources. One of the key differentiators of our program is the fact you experience your program on a diverse and complete college campus. Whether it is the library resources, the recreation center, or cheering for Division I-A sports teams, you are a full member of the Georgia Tech campus community.
How big is the alumni network?
The EMBA alumni network is more than 2,000 strong. In addition, the Georgia Tech and Scheller College of Business networks have hundreds of thousands of loyal members. 
Can I attend a class session to experience the program firsthand?
We will be happy to schedule a class visit for you to one of our EMBA classes. We request that you first attend one of our information sessions or submit your current resume for review to us at emba@gatech.edu. Upon completion of either of these requests, we will contact you to arrange a class visit that meets your schedule.






Admissions



What are the admission requirements?

Working professional with a minimum of five years of full-time career experience
Four-year bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Online application

Academic transcripts from all previous institutions
Current resume
Required essays (2): 

Why an MBA and why the Georgia Tech Scheller College of Business? Describe how your experience, both professional and personal, has led you to the decision to pursue an MBA at Georgia Tech. Discuss your short- and long-term career goals and how Scheller is best suited to help you achieve your goals (2,000 characters max).
List 10 facts about yourself that will help your future classmates get to know you.


Professional letters of recommendation (2)


Admissions interview
Official TOEFL score (if required)

How do I apply?
You will need to begin your application here. You are required to select your Executive MBA specialization at the time of application. We recommend you plan for one hour to complete your application.
For questions on the admissions process, the admissions team is here to assist you every step of the way. To connect with a member of the admissions team, please email us at emba@gatech.edu, call at 404.385.2254, or schedule a one-on-one consultation. 
When is the application deadline?
Applicants are admitted on a rolling admissions basis, with applications processed as they are submitted for the incoming class. We highly recommend submitting your application as early as possible to ensure your placement in the program. Class seats are awarded on a first-come, first-served basis. See application deadlines. 
Do I have to take the GMAT, GMAT Focus, GRE, or Executive Assessment?
The Executive MBA program has a test-optional admissions policy. Any applicant who can demonstrate strong quantitative skills through their academic and professional work experience is welcome to apply without a test score. Prospective students do not have to meet certain criteria in order to pursue this option.
Does my work experience need to be as a manager?
Your work experience should be in a professional setting, but you do not need to have managed people to apply.
Do I need to have an undergraduate degree?
Yes. You must have a four-year degree from a regionally accredited institution to apply. For international students, you must have a four-year degree equivalent.
How many people typically apply to the Executive MBA program?
We typically seat a class of 70 - 80 students each start, with about twice as many students applying. We prescreen applicants, so unqualified students typically remove themselves from the process and do not officially apply to the program.
Will I be interviewed?
Yes, each qualified applicant will be invited for a one-hour admissions interview as part of the application process.
When will I know if I have been accepted?
The admissions process typically takes two to four weeks after we have received your completed application and have conducted your admissions interview.
Whom may I contact if I have more questions?
Please contact the Executive MBA admissions team at 404.385.2254 or via email at emba@gatech.edu to learn more.






Tuition and Financing



How much does the program cost and what does tuition cover?
The program fee for the class is $84,563 (subject to change). This includes all textbooks, classroom materials, access to campus resources; on-ground costs for the international residency; on-campus parking across from the Scheller College of Business building; executive coaching, career development programs, and lifetime executive coaching for alumni; food and refreshments during scheduled class times; and admission to guest speaker events, symposia, and lectures.
Is my company required to sponsor me during the program?
Your company is not required to sponsor you financially or submit a letter of company support for your enrollment. We do suggest you discuss the time commitment required for the program and your program goals with your employer. This is an excellent way of positioning yourself for future opportunities within your company if your goal is advancement within your organization. 
Are scholarships available? 
Yes. We award a limited number of fellowships to Executive MBA students. Applicants who apply early receive first consideration. No additional application materials are required.
Is there financial aid available?
Yes. There are numerous financial aid options for which you may be eligible. To learn more, please visit finaid.gatech.edu for more information.






Directions, Parking, and Accommodations



How do I get to the Scheller College of Business?
View detailed directions and parking.
How do I get from the airport to the College?
Many visitors take MARTA (light rail) from the airport. There are two MARTA stations (North Avenue and Midtown) within blocks of the College and there are a variety of hotels and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.
There are many other options for traveling to and from Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport to Midtown Atlanta.
Are there hotels near campus?
Yes. There are many hotels to choose from near the College of Business and the Georgia Tech campus. Here are several options:(ask for Georgia Tech rates)Georgia Tech Hotel and Conference Center (across the street from Scheller College of Business)800 Spring Street NW, Atlanta, GA 30308Reservations: 404-347-9440; 800-706-2899This full-service hotel located on the Georgia Tech campus, offers restaurant, bar and room service seven days a week as well as numerous restaurant options just steps away. The hotel also features free wireless internet, fitness center (including indoor pool) and FREE transportation on the Tech. Ask for the Georgia Tech Rate!
Many of the hotels listed below also offer Georgia Tech rates. Be sure to ask!
Georgian Terrace (.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)659 Peachtree StreetAtlanta, GA 30308404-897-1991
Hilton Garden Inn/Homewood Suites (0.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)97 10th Street NWAtlanta, GA 30309404-524-4006
Hotel Indigo Atlanta Midtown (.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)683 Peachtree Street. NE Atlanta, GA 30308404-874-9200
Home2 Suites (.3 miles from the Scheller College of Business)975 West Peachtree St. NW, Atlanta, GA 30309800-642-3629
Renaissance Atlanta Hotel Downtown (.1 mile walk from Scheller College of Business)866 West Peachtree Street NW Atlanta, GA 30308678-412-2400
Residence Inn Atlanta Midtown / Historic (.5 miles from Scheller College of Business)1041 West Peachtree StreetAtlanta, GA 30309404-872-8885
Residence Inn Midtown/17th at Peachtree hotel (1.2 miles from Scheller College of Business)1365 W Peachtree St NEAtlanta, GA 30309404-745-1000

pages.title: Executive MBA Frequently Asked Questions

pages.content:
[HEADING] Executive MBA Career Advancement
[HEADING] Elevate Your Career
[HEADING] Executive MBA Career Development Resources
[HEADING] 1:1 Executive Career Coaching
[HEADING] Executive MBA Leadership Academy
[HEADING] Career Development Resources
[HEADING] Resume/LinkedIn Reviews and Practice Interviews
[HEADING] Alumni Career Panels
Advance within your current company. Explore your career options. Enhance your leadership skills. Wherever you're headed, Georgia Tech Scheller Executive MBA leadership coaching and career development career services can help you get there.
Even though Georgia Tech Scheller Executive MBA (EMBA) students are established professionals who are further along their career paths, career services and leadership development are an invaluable part of the program experience. Career services provides students with the one-on-one coaching, resources, and tools they need to proactively manage their career growth and reach their goals.
Career services supports a variety of career changes: transitioning to new functional areas, changing companies, shifting industries, moving into leadership roles, or starting a business. Students gain access to executive career coaching from career development professionals with decades of business and leadership experience.
Download Executive MBA Career Impact Report
“When I first started at Scheller, I was a mid-level manager with huge ambitions. Going to Scheller gave me the confidence to go to the next level and the level beyond that. The faculty, staff, the program, and the international aspect changed me forever. It gave me confidence and a perspective that made me into who I am today.”
– Brooke Carter

Executive MBA '16
Senior Director, Strategic Partnerships, Adobe
“The knowledge and network that come from this program are invaluable if you are looking to make a change, boost your confidence, expand your skillset, or even just increase your job security. I left the program with a fresh perspective and confidence in my current role, as well as a feeling of being more than qualified to be the best candidate for just about any job posting I happen to come across. This is a feeling that you cannot put a price tag on.”
– Blake Gordon

Executive MBA '21
Director of Innovation, Georgia-Pacific LLC
Charting your career path is a process of continual discovery. We provide a variety of resources to help you position your skills for career growth and change.
We offer one-on-one executive career coaching throughout your program and work with you individually to clarify your interests, motivators, values, and strengths. We support you through the process to help you achieve your unique individual career goals.
The EMBA Leadership Academy is designed to help students develop their personalized leadership development plan. Students who complete the full leadership development program will earn a certificate of completion.
Our resources are designed to help you develop and manage your career. Workshops cover these and other topics:
Work with your EMBA career coach to review and update your resume and LinkedIn profile to better attract employers. Also, refine your interview skills through practice interviews with your career coach to help put your best foot forward during your next interview.
These panels feature EMBA alumni who share their career journey stories and advice. There is also an opportunity for alumni to answer questions from the attending students and for students to interact directly with alumni.

Executive MBA Career Development Resources
Charting your career path is a process of continual discovery. We provide a variety of resources to help you position your skills for career growth and change.







1:1 Executive Career Coaching




We offer one-on-one executive career coaching throughout your program and work with you individually to clarify your interests, motivators, values, and strengths. We support you through the process to help you achieve your unique individual career goals.







Executive MBA Leadership Academy 



The EMBA Leadership Academy is designed to help students develop their personalized leadership development plan. Students who complete the full leadership development program will earn a certificate of completion. 

The Gallup CliftonStrengths Assessment, an objective in-depth assessment measuring natural abilities.
A Personalized Leadership Development Plan (PLDP) introduced in Immersion Week
Executive leadership coaching
Assignments/reflection papers incorporating EMBA classes and activities

Learn More






Career Development Resources



Our resources are designed to help you develop and manage your career. Workshops cover these and other topics:

Developing and applying an effective career development strategy
Networking strategies that work
Developing a customized executive resume and LinkedIn profile
Evaluating and negotiating job offers







Resume/LinkedIn Reviews and Practice Interviews




Work with your EMBA career coach to review and update your resume and LinkedIn profile to better attract employers. Also, refine your interview skills through practice interviews with your career coach to help put your best foot forward during your next interview.







Alumni Career Panels





These panels feature EMBA alumni who share their career journey stories and advice. There is also an opportunity for alumni to answer questions from the attending students and for students to interact directly with alumni.

Executive MBA Career Development Resources
Charting your career path is a process of continual discovery. We provide a variety of resources to help you position your skills for career growth and change.
1:1 Executive Career Coaching




We offer one-on-one executive career coaching throughout your program and work with you individually to clarify your interests, motivators, values, and strengths. We support you through the process to help you achieve your unique individual career goals.







Executive MBA Leadership Academy 



The EMBA Leadership Academy is designed to help students develop their personalized leadership development plan. Students who complete the full leadership development program will earn a certificate of completion.

Alumni Career Panels
